intro: Erycibe brunneopilosa, commonly known as the brown-hairy erycibe, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Erycibe brunneopilosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
